What is GraphQL?

  • A query language for your API
  • A server-side runtime for executing queries

A front for your business logic

  1. When talking about GraphQL referring to two separate things
  2. Query a way of retrieving data or mutating (updating) data
  3. Runtime a way of resolving a query into data

Querying


              query {
                customers {
                  name
                }
              }
            

                SELECT `example`.`foo`...
  1. Like SQL for APIs?
  2. Understanding of your entities and their relations You'll have a hard time writing anything if you don't

Resolving


              SELECT `example`.`foo`...
            

              query {
                example {
                  foo
                }
              }
  1. Previous examples
  2. Think about SQL Parse, optimise and execute against the data on disk
  3. Think about GraphQL Parse, optimise and execute against resolvers in your code

Your business is a graph


                type Customer {
                  id: Integer
                  name: String
                  orders: [Order]
                }

                type Order {
                  id: Integer
                  product: Product
                }

                type Product {
                  id: Integer
                  price: Integer
                  description: String
                }
  1. Think of your data as a series of nodes a node defines: functionally dependant fields of data
  2. Your nodes have edges (relations) edges define a link between one node and another
  3. Normalization rules help
